intro: Lastrea dissecta, commonly known as the dissected lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
